name: Stuffed Acorn Squash with Quinoa, Cranberries, and Pecans
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Place halved and seeded acorn squashes on a baking sheet, cut side up. Brush with olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and roast for 30-40 minutes until fork-tender. While the squash is roasting, rinse 1 cup of quinoa, then cook it in 2 cups of vegetable broth for 15-20 minutes until done. In a skillet, sauté 1 finely chopped onion and 2 minced cloves of garlic in 1 tablespoon of olive oil until softened. Add 1 teaspoon each of dried thyme and sage, 1/2 cup each of dried cranberries and chopped pecans; cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Mix in the cooked quinoa, season with salt and pepper. Fill each roasted acorn squash half with the quinoa mixture. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley, then serve and enjoy your delicious vegan Thanksgiving meal! Customize as desired and consider adding a drizzle of balsamic glaze or maple syrup for extra flavor.

name: Set Dosa
instructions: Soak 1 cup of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal together, and 1/4 cup of chana dal separately, in water for 4-6 hours or overnight. After soaking, drain the water and grind rice and urad dal together to form a smooth batter. Grind soaked chana dal with flattened rice (poha) to create a paste, and add it to the rice and urad dal batter. Mix the batter well, add salt, sugar, and let it ferment for 8-12 hours or overnight. After fermentation, the batter will rise. Add 1/2 cup of semolina (rava) and 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda to the batter. Mix thoroughly.
